title: Emails from AOL Mail in  Windows 10
content:
Installed Thunderbird on my Windows 10 laptop. Copied profile from my Windows XP laptop.

When trying to get messages I'm prompted for a password. Entering password and clicking OK, status bar shows "Sending login info..." and nothing happens, not even a timeout message.

(Running Thunderbird "As Administrator" does NOT make a difference.)

When running Thunderbird in Troubleshooting mode, I'm not prompted for password and I DO get messages from the AOL Mail server.

"Troubleshoot Mode will disable all add-ons and temporarily use some default preferences". No Add-ons installed. What are the "some default preferences"?

It would appear to be preference(s) related to stored passwords, transmitting passwords or such, and how do I change the relevant preference(s) ?

Finn
creator: finn.lassen

title: calendar [lightning] notifications / reminders
content:
As far as I can tell, calendar reminders are able to have an audible alert with a window that persists (when show reminder dialog is checked), but multiple reminders for a single event aren't possible.

OTOH, calendar notifications can have multiple notifications, but do not have a sound, nor do their windows stick around. The duration is less than 20 secs; they can be easily missed if you're not watching.

What I want is a combination of the two: a reminder a few minutes before an event *and* at the start, with a window that persists. Is there a set of options that will give us this?

Tnx!
creator: mspiegel

title: Can't get Thunderbird to download messages...need help please!
content: I currently use Thunderbird on my work computer (windows 11) and my home computer (windows 10) My email is through Microsoft 365 and the above access it fine using POP settings. I got a new computer for home using Windows 11 to replace my Windows 10 older computer. I have installed Thunderbird on the new computer using the exact same settings as the other two computers. Problem: When starting Thunderbird, it sits on 'contacting host' for a long time (3-4 minutes) then says no new messages. However, I know there are new messages as I get them through the old computer and I also see them on Microsoft 365 web based email access. I have checked all the firewall settings, etc. Everything is set the same as the old computer sitting next to the new computer. I am stumped as to why it won't download new messages as it's connecting to the server. Please help....thanks.
creator: toddj98

title: Thunderbird Icons have disappeared?
content: I am currently working with 102.14.0 (64 bit) version of Thunderbird and am having a problem with displaying any of the available Icon sets. I used to use Phoenity Icons and Buttons but got a bit fed up with them and started using Old Icons which worked a treat but for some reason they no longer appear. They flash up briefly when I start Thunderbird but revert to default after a millisecond. Has anyone got any idea how I could restore these Icons? Sorry if this is a stupid question and I am missing something obvious but I don't seem to be able to find a solution. I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling, disabling and re-enabling but nothing seems to make any difference. Any help would be much appreciated.
creator: njtinker

title: Change line spacing in paragraph mode
content:
How can I change the line spacing in paragraph mode in Thunderbird 102.14.0 (64-bit)?

People sometimes send me a message in single linespace, and I want to use double linespace. How can I do that?
creator: terryhokn

title: Remote content in Thunderbird for Linux messages - notification bar fails to appear
content:
The notification bar should appear whenever there's undisplayed remote content. Being able to load remote content for an individual message is important.

Thunderbird Help tells me to click "preferences" in the "notification bar", but usually that notification bar simply fails to appear. Bizarrely, visiting settings can trigger it to appear. Otherwise, it's absent.

The notification bar should appear whenever there's undisplayed remote content. My version of Thunderbird is 102.13.0 (64-bit).
creator: sibelman

title: Thunderbird email client
content:
T-bird sometimes downloads email like normal. Often, perhaps an hour later it won't download email and gives me this message: Unable to write the email to the mailbox. Make sure the file system allows you write privileges, and you have enough disk space to copy the mailbox.

This may be related to an update, I don't know. It started in the last week and is annoying. I use T-bird exclusively because I like to save emails on my desktop.

Thank you... Dale Warren [removed email from public]
creator: BlueArkie

title: Non riesco a scaricare le pec di Aruba inviate
content:
Vorrei utilizzare Thunderbird per poter fare il Backup di tutte le pec della mia casella di Aruba, al fine di cancellare queste ultime e crearmi così spazio gratis; al momento ho scelto per Thunderbird il protocollo pop3.pec.it e non so se ho fatto bene; sono riuscito a scaricare su Thunderbird esclusivamente le pec Aruba in arrivo, ma non quelle inviate. Ho tentato di importare anche le pec inviate, ma mi compare il messaggio: 

 Accesso al server pop3.pec.it con nome utente ...........@pec.it non riuscito

Riprova Inserire una nuova password Ho provato ad inserire una nuova psw, ma nessun risultato. Cosa devo fare? Grzie
creator: guelfoungaro

title: Falha ao tentar login no Oauth2 no Thunderbird 115 no Live Hotmail
content:
Migrei do Thunderbird 102.6 para o Thunderbird 115.1.1 e quando fui tentar fazer login em minhas contas do Hotmail tive uma janela pedindo-me para fazer login no Oauth2 em duas de minhas contas que foram criadas este ano, e o fiz e estas funcionam sem problêmas, porém nas minhas contas mais antigas, também do Hotmail; a janela de Oauth2 até carrega mas fecha-se antes que e-mail e senha sejam solicitados impedindo-me de fazer login. A janela do Oauth2 carrega e fecha-se sozinha sem solicitar-me e-mail e senha.

Nas configurações do Thunderbird as configurações estão as mesmas para as contas de e-mail que funcionam e para as que não funcionam...

O que pode estar havendo?

Por que as contas que criei este ano estão funcionado e as antigas não?

Grato por qualquer ajuda.
creator: md1328

title: Cant Log in to my Proton mail through Thunderbird
content:
Work environment

  • Windows 10 64 bit
  • Proton Mail bridge
  • Thunderbird V15.1

What I did 1. Downloaded & installed Proton Mail Bridge 2. Downloaded & installed Thunderbird 3. logged in to my Proton account with Proton Mail bridge 4. entered my Proton's email and passowrd at Thunderbird 5. Entered "Proton Mail" under "Your full name" 6. Pressed done

what i expected Thunderbird will successfully sync with my ProtonMail account. I will be able to vew my emails through Thunderbird

what actually happened. a yellow error box saying "Unable to log in at server, Probebly Wrong configuration, username or password"


    • What i tried to do**

- Checked that both Thunderbird and ProtonMail are not blokced by the firewall

Notes: ProtonMail bridge sometimes pop that error alert when im pressing "Done" on Thunderbird. I am not sure what it means by "local Bridge password" were it is. and what should i do with it. if it all

creator: mark369

title: Thunderbird multiple accounts - error is blocking other accounts
content:
I have multiple email accounts - some with gmail. Whenever an error occurs with one account (google asked to login and confirm T-Bird is allowed access) then T-Bird blocks requests/checking of other accounts until the error is fixed.

It should time out on that account and then move to the next account and actually check the mail.

anyone have a fix for this?

thanks

Example: 5 accounts A, B, C, D, E

Account A is checked = OK

Account B fails = T-Birds stops and does not check C, D, E accounts.
creator: nemo1966

creator: 5togdoova21

title: Running Thunderbird flatpak under wayland
content:
On Linux, how can users run Thunderbird's flatpak using the wayland compositor?

A good approach is to set a user-level override to force the flatpak to render with the wayland compositor, using the associated socket:

`flatpak override --user --env=MOZ_ENABLE_WAYLAND=1 --socket=wayland org.mozilla.Thunderbird`
creator: MrNycticorax

title: Transferring email data from iinet Australia to Thunderbird
content: In Australia iiNet is turning off all email support I have installed Thunderbird and now need help transferring all the iinet email service to thunderbird .
creator: ricben

title: Thunderbird slow deleting emails
content: My thunderbird works okay, but when I select emails from imbox folder to delete it takes too long. I researched to find the problem and the only option I found was to add an exclusion to the profile folder on my windows security antivirus. Now I can select emails from the imbox and delete them without a problem, but my concern is if I will be vulnerable to virus.
creator: gilboston2003
